messages: c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:11): you beat me to taking it off channel
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:12): is your problem occurring on a different computer than the one you are ircing with?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:12): i'm not in any hurry so take your time
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:13): i can't believe how many connections i have reported by netstat -a
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:13): do you have something like label windoze?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:14): # For booting Windows NT or Windows95
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:14): #title Windows NT / Windows 95 boot menu
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:14): # For loading DOS if Windows NT is installed
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:15): i had it running at one time or another, long time ago
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:15): THAT is for your SECOND hard drive
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:15): ithought thre was something like mapto or something
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:17): did you reinstall grub after 2000 was installed on hdb1?
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:17): i went into grub, and told it the fololowing
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:18): just saying i wouldn't use grub-install
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:18): so your /boot partition is on hd1,2?
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:18): you know what my fingers are garbling
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:19): your /boot and / should be separate partitions
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:19): i'm taking a linux class that it should come up at least a few times again why debian doesn't do /boot separately by default
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:20): i have been using linux for over 12 years
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:20): took me a long time to understand
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:20): separate /boot partition has many benefits
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:20): you could put /boot on a flash drive
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:21): but anyway, back to your problem
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:21): how do i fix my dilemna?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:21): i've had windows on any drive before
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:22): i've put windows 2000 at the very end of an 80 gb drive on hdd
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:22): i've had lilo and grub on hda's mbr or fd0
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:23): got an idea,  but it's weird
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:23): do you have a combo of ide/sata drives?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:24): do you have an add-n ide pci controller?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:24): no, leave cdrom as hdd
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:24): they don't make the blasted things screw-up-able
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:25): which also means they make it so you can hardly upgrade them
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:25): right, so simply ide0 is hda/b and ide1 is hdc/d
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:25): grub is a little wierd like that, compared to lilo if you have any previous experience with lilo..
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:25): grub doesn't go by hda/b/c/d
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:26): it goes by first device second third..
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:26): you said you had error 15?
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:26): no.. i got as goofly char error
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:27): so can you boot linux?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:28): you have linux on hda?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:30): is 2k the only thing you can't boot?
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:30): left winme ot of the picture so far
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:31): it shouldn't be needed, to_drive
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:31): put hdb on hda, do clean install of 2k there, then move it to hdb
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:32): install grub on new hda with current settings
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:32): does that make any sense?
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:32): or put it this way
c4055e3a20b6b3af3d10590ea446ef6c (13:33): when installing NTish OS on ANY drive, it ALWAYS writes over the boot sector and MBR of the first drive according to the BIOS
03aa43bea4f93697664a69fef3117299 (13:34): wrote grub weith the map command to hd0 again
